thread.title: Sen. Schumer to Endorse Michael McMahon for Staten Island DA
thread.title_full: Sen. Schumer to Endorse Michael McMahon for Staten Island DA

author: Ryan Haas
title: Sen. Schumer to Endorse Michael McMahon for Staten Island DA
text:
Share Photo credit: The Brooklyn Paper | Julie Rosenberg 
Sen. Chuck Schumer will endorse Michael McMahon on Thursday in a race to be Staten Island’s next District Attorney. The announcement will come at 3:30 p.m. at the Staten Island Boardwalk (Intersection of Sand Lane and Father Capodanno) The senator has represented the people of New York State in the United States Senate since 1999. As for McMahon, the DA hopeful has been a Staten Island trial lawyer for over 25 years, appearing in courts at all levels throughout New York State. He previously served the people of Staten Island as a Civic Association President, New York City Council Member, and Member of Congress, while currently acting as a partner and co-chair of the Government Relations Practice Group at the international law firm Herrick Feinstein. McMahon was previously endorsed from the New York State Court Officers Associations, the Association of Surrogates, Supreme Court Reporters, the Sergeants Benevolent Association, the Uniformed Firefighters Association, the Uniformed Fire Officers Association, the District Council of Carpenters, the Patrolmen’s Benevolent Association, the Uniformed Sanitationmen’s Association, the Captains Endowment Association, the Lieutenants Benevolent Association, the Detectives Endowment Association, The Bridge and Tunnel Officers Benevolent Association, the NYC Deputy Sheriffs Association, the Amalgamated Transit Union Local 726, and the United Federation of Teachers.
